cleaned_text: Top in allergy/asthma: Vitamin D reduces wheezing; update on urticaria after vaccination [Click Here to Manage Email Alerts](javascript:void(0)) [customerservice@slackinc.com](mailto:customerservice@slackinc.com). A recent study showed that vitamin D supplementation during pregnancy has a protective effect on the respiratory health of children — specifically, it reduced wheezing. Researchers said the benefits are likely due to specific alterations to the mother's metabolism. A metabolome enriched with sphingomyelins was associated with a decreased risk for recurrent wheeze and wheeze exacerbations in children, they wrote, adding that childhood asthma prevention strategies may consider therapies that target the maternal sphingomyelin metabolism. It was the top story in allergy/asthma last week. Another top story was about an international, observational study of 2,769 adults with chronic urticaria, finding that 9% experienced exacerbations after COVID-19 vaccination.
